title: EastEnders spoilers: Dotty splits up Tiffany and Keegan?
text:
After a decade away, Dotty Cotton (Milly Zero) returned in EastEnders several weeks back, and — although there was a bit of a question mark over what her motives for being back in the Square truly are — it appears as if she will be getting up to her old tricks after all, as she causes trouble for Keegan Baker (Zack Morris) in the coming episodes.

Several weeks ago, Dot (June Brown) surprised everyone when she returned unannounced with granddaughter Dotty — aka Kirsty — in tow. While Sonia (Natalie Cassidy) and Stuart (Ricky Champ) were pleased to see the Walford icon back on the Square, Tiffany (Maisie Smith) was less than pleased with Dotty’s return, as she knew it could only spell trouble.

Thus far, it’s been rather hard to gauge what Dotty’s motives for being back in the Square are, and it would certainly seem like she’s matured quite a bit over the past decade, but her true colours could be set to come to light, as she causes problems in the coming episodes when she tries to sabotage Keegan’s business.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Following the incident with Dotty, Ian (Adam Woodyatt) — who’s kitchen Keegan has been working out of — encourages the young man to give up. But whether or not he does so remains to be seen.

Later in the week, Tiffany’s fuming when she discovers what Dotty did, and wastes little time in confronting her.

But what will Dotty have to say for herself?

It’s clear from her actions that she’s trying to cause trouble for Keegan, but given than her and Tiff haven’t exactly got off on the right foot, could she perhaps be trying to split the happy couple up?

Or will there be a perfectly reasonable explanation for her actions?

One to watch: Tuesday 29th October at 7:30pm on BBC One.

Advertisement Advertisement
description: Dotty's true colours are seemingly coming to light.
